Doing is much harder than talking. I'd like to be known as a doer, not a talker. Someone who does what means most to him. Someone who actually does what he says he will do. Someone who always does the right thing. Someone who does.

But how do you become someone who does? How do you break your own mold, when it was you who created the mold in the first place? Is not the mold I created truly my character?

I can be so much better. I can do so much better. I can do so much more. 

Work harder. Do more.

This feels good.

Jordan

entry.title: Day 2: TIMU
entry.content:
Today I Messed Up

Normally it is TIFU but let's keep it PG


Something that I have repeated several times with my wife is telling her what my plans are, rather than asking her if my plans fall in line with her thoughts. It's not enough to just plan ahead. I need to ask her if it's alright. We are a team. It's not what I think is necessary but this is simple. Get in the habit of doing that. 

By not doing this, I managed to mess up having dinner with my wife, going on a walk with my wife and I was late to the thing that I planned on doing without asking her if it was okay. It was a mess.

Us smiling (look at her cool hair!)

In this post I want to establish some of my goals for this upcoming year. 

As you know, I want to blog everyday for a year. But there are a few other things that I would like to improve/plan.

  1. I'm gonna run a half marathon on September 18th. That means I need to get fit.
  2. I want to supplement my engineering income with freelance web development. My goal is to be making at least $1000 a month on top of my salary. That means that I really need to learn Javascript properly, and also do something more than work off of a bootstrap template.
  3. I'm going to read more. I would like to read both the Bible and another book everyday for at least 15 minutes each. That means I actually need to open a book everyday.
  4. I want to exponentially increase my work rate at my employment. That means that I will need to get better organized about how I spend my time and also I need to develop better relationships with my coworkers.
  5. I want to continue to deepen my relationship with my wife, family, and friends. That means I need to at least pick up my phone once in a while to make a call and not just consume content.

That means I need to get fit. That means that I really need to learn Javascript properly, and also do something more than work off of a bootstrap template. That means I actually need to open a book everyday. That means that I will need to get better organized about how I spend my time and also I need to develop better relationships with my coworkers. That means I need to at least pick up my phone once in a while to make a call and not just consume content.

Now that I know what I have to do, now I need to actually plan how I am going to do it. That's a little more difficult, and something that Hannah is really good at. I will be soliciting her help.

This feels good.

Jordan

entry.title: Day 1: Day 1
entry.content:
This is a Blog for Me


This is something I want to do because I need to create more than I consume


I'm planning on doing a blog everyday. Every. Single. Day. For an entire year. It won't have a planned theme, audience, agenda or content. The only think planned about this blog is that it is going to happen everyday.

About me: I'm 23, soon to be 24. I work a 9 - 5 job as an electrical engineer for a big company. I graduated from the Rochester Institute of Technology in 2014 with a bachelor's in electrical engineering. I have a beautiful wife, Hannah, and a baby on the way (due August 12th). 

I'm about 8 months into having adulthood thrown at me, and I feel like I'm already plateauing. Plateauing in terms of my growth as an individual. I have severe conflicts with who I want to be and who I usually end up being at the end of the day.

I love my life. It is amazing. I have a great family and great friends, a great (squishy/comfortable) job, plenty of opportunity and time for success, and I'm genuinely healthy.

I hate my life. It is awful. I have a great family and great friends, a great (squishy/comfortable) job, plenty of opportunity and time for success, and I'm genuinely healthy.

It makes me lazy. It makes me not think about the things I need to do to grow and change as an individual. It allows me to stagnate, get fat, not care, work less, and consume consume consume. It makes me think I am better than I am, and that I am entitled to the things I have. 

I put on a good show, sure. Many people I know think I have it all together. I don't, and it's time I actually owned up to that. I'm not the best person that I could be. I'm not working as hard as I could be. I'm not as healthy as I could be. I'm not as invested in my relationships as I could be.

I am declaring war on my life. My default self - my genuine self, sucks. That needs to change. My default self needs to realize that I should not take anything for granted, and that I need to work harder than anyone on the planet. My default self needs to wake up every morning and create, not wake up and consume. My default self needs to be the person I could be, not the person I am.

This feels good.

Jordan
